perturbation.original_text: 2. Term of Agreement. The term of this Agreement shall be for one (1) year commencing on the Effective Date and automatically renewing annually thereafter, unless either party provides a thirty-day notice of written termination one to the other ("Term").
perturbation.changed_text: 2. Term of Agreement. The term of this Agreement shall be for one (1) year commencing on the Effective Date and automatically renewing annually thereafter, unless either party provides a thirty-day notice of written termination one to the other ("Term"). The term can also be terminated by ESSI if the talent does not maintain a certain level of social media engagement, defined as posting at least 3 times per week.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a second, conflicting condition for termination. Section 2 initially defines 'Term' termination as requiring a 30-day notice. The added sentence allows ESSI to terminate based on a different criterion (social media engagement), creating ambiguity as to when and how the contract can be terminated. It's unclear if ESSI needs to provide 30 days notice if terminating based on social media engagement. This creates in-text contradiction about the term of agreement.

perturbation.original_text:
4. Duties of Talent and Rights of ESSI. During the Term and subject to the limitations set forth in Paragraphs 9 and 10, Talent agrees to provide ESSI with the following:
A. Upon request by ESSI, two (2) production sessions to be used for the production of the various medias to be used in Commercial placements ("Production Sessions")余 the location, date and time of the Production Sessions shall be mutually agreed upon by Talent and ESSI. In the event any Production Session exceeds eight (8) hours in duration ESSI and Talent will negotiate in good faith additional compensation to Talent for time in excess of eight (8) hours.
B. Talent will serve as a Special Advisor to ESSI, whose sole responsibility is to be listed as a brand ambassador on the Websites and/or ESSI related press releases. With respect to Talent's position as Special Advisory, Talent will not be responsible for any additional services such as attending meetings, corporate functions, etc.
C. ESSI may request an additional production session(s), or a media tour or personal appearance(s) of Talent for an additional fee to be mutually agreed upon by the parties.
perturbation.changed_text:
4. Duties of Talent and Rights of ESSI. During the Term and subject to the limitations set forth in Paragraphs 9 and 10, Talent agrees to provide ESSI with the following:
A. Upon request by ESSI, two (2) production sessions to be used for the production of the various medias to be used in Commercial placements ("Production Sessions")余 the location, date and time of the Production Sessions shall be at ESSI's sole discretion. In the event any Production Session exceeds eight (8) hours in duration ESSI will only provide the same compensation regardless of time in excess of eight (8) hours.
B. Talent will serve as a Special Advisor to ESSI, whose sole responsibility is to be listed as a brand ambassador on the Websites and/or ESSI related press releases. With respect to Talent's position as Special Advisory, Talent will be responsible for attending essential meetings and corporate functions, as designated by ESSI.
C. ESSI may request an additional production session(s), or a media tour or personal appearance(s) of Talent without any additional fee.
perturbation.explanation: This change modifies the original agreement in several conflicting ways. Initially, the production sessions required mutual agreement on location and time. The modified text gives ESSI sole discretion. Furthermore, it changes the compensation for additional hours. Finally, it says Talent is not responsible for attending meetings, then it changes to Talent being responsible for attending essential meetings and corporate functions. This creates in-text contradiction regarding the agreed upon duties, giving rise to uncertainty.

perturbation.original_text:
9.Review, Approval, and Ownership of Commercial Placements. All ESSI uses of Talent Attributes in connection with the Commercial Placements and/or press releases shall be subject to the prior written approval of Talent. Said written approval must be given within five (5) business days of Talent's receipt or said usage shall be deemed unapproved. Any such usage featuring Talent in the Commercial Placements and/or press releases shall be and remain the property of ESSI余 however, ESSI shall have the right to use said Commercial Placements and/or press releases solely as outlined in Paragraph 3 and only during the Term. Talent may use said materials in whole or in part solely for the purpose of presenting Talent's work in Talent's personal portfolio, website or otherwise and/or on Talent's agent's website. Such usage may not be sold or transferred.
9.1 Press Releases. Talent may not, at any time, individually, or through his agent, manager, family, friends, or associates publish a press release relative to ESSI without first obtaining the written consent and approval of ESSI's management and counsel. In the event Talent does publish any such press release, this Agreement shall be null and void and any outstanding balance owed to Talent shall be voided and the 1,000,000 Shares of ESSI common stock issued to Talent returned to the Company.
perturbation.changed_text:
9.Review, Approval, and Ownership of Commercial Placements. All ESSI uses of Talent Attributes in connection with the Commercial Placements and/or press releases shall be subject to the prior written approval of Talent. However, if Talent fails to provide written approval within fourteen (14) business days of Talent's receipt, ESSI shall proceed anyway. Any such usage featuring Talent in the Commercial Placements and/or press releases shall be and remain the property of ESSI余 however, ESSI shall have the right to use said Commercial Placements and/or press releases at any time without consequence. Talent may use said materials in whole or in part for commercial resale without limitation.
9.1 Press Releases. Talent may publish any press release relative to ESSI at any time without restriction.
perturbation.explanation: The original section requires Talent's approval for commercial placements and press releases. If approval isn't received in five days, the usage is 'deemed unapproved'. In contradiction, the revised version states ESSI can proceed if no approval is given in fourteen days. Additionally, Talent is now able to use such images for commercial resale, reversing the prior text and creating ambiguity. The contradiction that really does the trick, however, is the removal of the restriction on Talent publishing press releases, completely contradicting clause 9.1.
